subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] New Character needed?
msgSnippet: I don t know that answer, that s why I asked. 87) This will have to be decided by those who create fonts and unicode proposals. I will humbly submit that Read
messageBody:
I don't know that answer, that's why I asked. 87)

This will have to be decided by those who create
fonts and unicode proposals.

I will humbly submit that Read himself did use just
such dots when explicating his new alphabet - that's
where I got the idea.
Also, your excellent large alphabet list (thanks,
by the way) uses explicit baselines to make the
characters clear.

--- Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
> request is another matter. So yes, it sounds like a
> good idea, but on
> balance, is it worth the space?

===========
Never insult anyone by accident.
- Robert A. Heinlein
